meanings.definition: To surpass in slickness or smoothness.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outslick her opponent by using a faster route.
meanings.sent2: The new car design outslicks all the previous models in terms of aerodynamics.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outslick the dog by sliding on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent4: His dance moves outslicked everyone else on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The ice skater's performance outslicked all the others with its grace and precision.

meanings.definition: To outdo in cleverness or cunning.
meanings.sent1: He managed to outslick his competitors with his quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outslick the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to outslick the farmer by stealing the corn in a sneaky way.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to win the game was to outslick her opponents with a clever strategy.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was so well thought out, it outslicked the audience's expectations.
